overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a robust approach to time-series forecasting with limited data, focusing on handling outliers and daily seasonality. It prioritizes heuristic methods over complex models due to the short 4-day history, employing median-based profiling and scaling to maintain pattern integrity while mitigating outlier effects.
key_insights: Using hourly medians to create a daily profile for outlier robustness
Scaling the profile to match the last day's level (using median for outlier resistance)
Explicit handling of data limitations (e.g., inability to capture weekly seasonality)
Trade-off analysis between model complexity and data availability
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines multi-step heuristic processing (median profiling, scaling, outlier handling) with statistical reasoning, while consciously avoiding overcomplicated models due to data constraints.
